content.text:
## Analysis of the Main Target Image

### Count & Layers:
The structure consists of approximately 13-14 blocks arranged in multiple layers:
- Bottom layer: Yellow rectangular blocks as supports, green rectangular block, red arch block
- Middle layer: Red bridge block with arches, green rectangular blocks as platforms
- Top layer: Yellow tall blocks, green blocks, blue cube blocks, orange triangular blocks

### Spatial Relationships:
- The structure resembles a vehicle or train with:
  - A red bridge section with arches at the front
  - A red arch/tunnel section in the middle
  - A platform made of green rectangular blocks
  - Blue cube blocks positioned on top of the green platform
  - Yellow tall blocks standing vertically at the front section
  - Orange triangular blocks at the rear right side
  - Small yellow block visible near the back underneath the structure

## Selected Blocks from Dictionary

Based on my analysis, I need the following blocks:

1. Red arch block (index 1) - used for the front of the structure
2. Red curved/tunnel block (index 3) - used for the middle section
3. Blue cube blocks (index 4) - two of these are used on top of the green platform
4. Red cube block (index 5) - possibly used as support
5. Green rectangular blocks (index 6 and index 8) - used as platforms and supports
6. Green vertical block (index 7) - used as vertical support
7. Yellow rectangular block (index 9) - used as horizontal support
8. Yellow tall blocks (index 10) - used as vertical columns, need at least 3
9. Orange cube block (index 11) - used in the rear section
10. Orange triangular blocks (indices 12, 13, 14, 15, and/or 16) - used for the angled sections at the rear

## Assembly Order

```
{
   Step1: Move block with index 9
   Step2: Move block with index 10
   Step3: Move block with index 10
   Step4: Move block with index 10
   Step5: Move block with index 8
   Step6: Move block with index 7
   Step7: Move block with index 6
   Step8: Move block with index 1
   Step9: Move block with index 3
   Step10: Move block with index 6
   Step11: Move block with index 8
   Step12: Move block with index 4
   Step13: Move block with index 4
   Step14: Move block with index 11
   Step15: Move block with index 12
   Step16: Move block with index 13
}
```

This assembly sequence builds from the bottom up, starting with the base supports, then adding the vertical elements, followed by the horizontal platforms, and finally the top elements.
